text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

Sale of Tickets (Cultural, Entertainment, Recreational and 
Sporting Events) Act 2021 

Application for Designation of a Venue 

Part One 

Details of applicant 

A venue operator may apply for the designation of a venue where the requirements of section 7(1) of the Act are met. Note 
one. 
An application for the designation of a venue must comply with the requirements of section 7(2) of the Act. Note two. 

Applicants are asked to complete all Parts of this form and, unless otherwise stated, to do so in BLOCK 
CAPITALS. 

Name of Applicant: 

Address of Applicant: 

Address 1: 

Address 2: 

Town: 

County: 

Country: 

Postcode/Eircode: 

Telephone Number: 

E-mail address: 

Website: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [399] 

 Do you own, manage or are otherwise responsible for the operation of the venue? 

Yes 

No 

 Are you acting for, or on behalf of, an owner, a manager or a person otherwise 

responsible for the operation of the venue? 

Yes 

No 

Please state, as applicable, your relation (a) to the venue, or (b) to the owner, manager, or other person 
responsible for the operation of the venue for whom, or on whose behalf, you are acting: 

Part Two 

Details of venue and statement of 
applicant 

Section 7(1) of the Act provides that a venue applicant may apply for the designation of a venue if (a) the venue 
has the capacity to hold 1,000 persons or more and (b) the venue applicant is of the reasonable opinion that the 
venue will hold events which may give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages by a secondary ticket seller for 
a price exceeding the original sale price. 

Name of Venue: 

Address of Venue: 

Address 1: 

Address 2: 

Town: 

County: 

 Eircode: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [399] 5 

Telephone Number: 

E-mail address: 

 Website: 

Capacity of venue 

Please indicate in the box below the capacity of the venue which is the subject of this application for designation. 

Capacity of the venue: 

Statement of reasonable opinion of applicant 

I am of the reasonable opinion that events taking place in the venue which is the subject of this application may 
give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages for a price exceeding the original sale price. 

Please state the basis for this opinion. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [399] 

I, the undersigned, declare that the information provided in this application is true and complete. 

DECLARATION 

Name of applicant (in 
BLOCK CAPITALS): 

Signature of applicant: 

(handwritten or electronic 
signature is acceptable) 

 Date: D D M M 

Y Y 

Please tick this box if you consent to the notice of designation being sent by 
electronic means: 

The Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment will notify venue operators whose applications for designation 
have been approved. Note three. 

Venues that have been designated will be placed on a public register of designated venues. Note four. 

Venue operators are asked to inform the Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment of any changes 
to the information provided in the application for designation that arise after the notification of the 
designation. 

Please keep a copy of this form for your own records. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [399] 7 

NOTES ON COMPLETION OF FORM 

General 

Before completing this form, applicants are advised to familiarise 
themselves with the Act, in particular the provisions of Part 2 on 
the designation of venues and events. 

 A link to the Act is available at www.irishstatutebook.gov.ie. 

Note one 

Section 7(1) of the Act provides that a venue operator may apply 
to the Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment to have one 
or more venues designated for the purposes of the Act if – 

(a) the venue has the capacity to hold 1,000 persons or more, 

and 

(b) the venue operator is of the reasonable opinion that the 
venue will hold events which may give rise to the sale of 
tickets or ticket packages by a secondary ticket seller for 
a price exceeding the original sale price. 

Section 2 of the Act provides that “venue operator” means a 
person who – 

(a) owns or manages a venue or is otherwise responsible for 

the operation of the venue, or 

(b) a person, including an event organiser, acting for, or on 

behalf of, a person referred to in paragraph (a). 

Note two 

Section 7(2) of the Act provides that an application for the 
designation of a venue shall be in writing and in such form as the 
Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment may prescribe 
and shall include – 

(a) the name, address, e-mail address, telephone number and 

website address of the applicant, 

(b) the address of the venue, or if the application concerns 
more than one venue, the address of each of those venues, 

(c) the capacity of the venue, or if the application concerns 
more than one venue, the capacity of each of the venues, 
and 

(d) a statement that the venue applicant is of the reasonable 
opinion that events taking place in the venue, or if the 
application concerns more than one venue, in each of the 
venues, may give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket 
packages by a secondary ticket seller for a price 
exceeding the original sale price. 

 
 
 
 
 
 8 [399] 

Note three 

Section 7(5) of the Act provides that the Minister for Enterprise, 
Trade and Employment may – 

(a) designate a venue that has been the subject of an 
application for designation under section 7(1) of the Act 
where the Minister is satisfied that the application 
complies with the conditions specified in that subsection, 
or 

(b) refuse to designate a venue where the Minister is not so 

satisfied. 

Section 7(7) of the Act provides that where the Minister 
designates a venue under section 7(5), the Minister shall notify 
the venue operator in writing of the designation. 

Section 7(8) of the Act provides that a notification of a venue 
designation shall include the reason for the designation and the 
date on which it will come into effect. 

Note four 

Section 14 of the Act provides that the Minister for Enterprise, 
Trade and Employment shall establish and maintain a register of 
designated venues and events and shall publish the register on the 
internet or in such other manner as the Minister considers 
appropriate. 

Completed and signed forms can be submitted: 

A. Electronically (pdf) by e-mail to: conspol@enterprise.gov.ie, or 

B. Printed and sent by post to: 

Competition and Consumer Policy Section 

Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment 

1 Earlsfort Centre 

Lower Hatch Street 

Dublin 2 

D02 PW01 

NB: As staff are working remotely at present, scanned copies of forms sent 
by post should also be sent by e-mail to: conspol@enterprise.gov.ie. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [399] 9

heading: Sale of Tickets (Cultural, Entertainment, Recreational and
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 2 

Sale of Tickets (Cultural, Entertainment, Recreational and 
Sporting Events) Act 2021 

Application for Designation of an Event 

Part One 

Details of applicant 

An event organiser or venue operator may apply for the designation of an event where the requirements of section 9(1) of the 
Act are met. Note one. 
An application for the designation of an event must comply with the requirements of section 9(3) of the Act. Note two 

Applicants are asked to complete all Parts of this form and, unless otherwise stated, to do so in BLOCK 
CAPITALS. 

Name of Applicant: 

Address of Applicant: 

Address 1: 

Address 2: 

Town: 

County: 

Country: 

Postcode/Eircode: 

Telephone Number: 

E-mail address: 

Website: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [399] 

 Are you the organiser of the event or the operator of the venue where the event is 

taking place? 

 Are you acting for, or on behalf of, the organiser of the event or the operator of 

the venue where the event is taking place? 

Yes 

No 

Yes 

No 

Please state, as applicable, your relation to (a) the event, (b) the venue where the event is taking place or 
(c) the venue operator or event organiser on whose behalf you are acting: 

Part Two 

Details of event and statement of 
applicant 

Section 9(1) of the Act provides that an event applicant may apply for the designation of an event if the event 
applicant is of the reasonable opinion that the event may give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages by a 
secondary ticket seller for a price exceeding the original sale price. 

This Part and the Declaration of the applicant must be completed for each event for which an application 
for designation is made. 

Details of event: 

Name of 
Event: 

Date(s) of 
Event: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Description of Event: 

[399] 11 

A. Is this an event which takes place on an annual basis in the same venue? 

B. Is this an event which takes place on some other periodic basis in the same venue? 

Yes 

 No 

If B, please state the periodic basis on which the event takes place. 

Yes 

 No 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12 [399] 

Details of venue where event will take place 

Name of Venue: 

Address of Venue: 

Address 1: 

Address 2: 

Town: 

County: 

 Eircode: 

Telephone Number: 

E-mail address: 

 Website: 

Statement of reasonable opinion of applicant 

I am of the reasonable opinion that the event taking place in the venue which is the subject of this application may 
give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages for a price exceeding the original sale price. 

Please state the basis for this opinion. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [399] 13 

DECLARATION 

I, the undersigned, declare that the information provided in this application is true and complete. 

Name of applicant (in 
BLOCK CAPITALS): 

Signature of applicant: 

(handwritten or electronic 
signature is acceptable) 

 Date: D D M M 

Y Y 

Please tick this box if you consent to the notice of designation being sent by 
electronic means: 

The Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment will notify event applicants whose applications for designation 
have been approved. Note three. 

Events that have been designated will be placed on a public register of designated events. Note four. 

Event applicants are asked to inform the Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment of any 
changes to the information provided in the application for designation that arise after the notification of 
the designation. 

Please keep a copy of this form for your own records. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [399] 

NOTES ON COMPLETION OF FORM 

General 

Before completing this form, applicants are advised to 
familiarise themselves with the Act, in particular the 
provisions of Part 2 on the designation of venues and events. 

 A link to the Act is available at www.irishstatutebook.ie. 

Note one 

Section 9(1) of the Act provides that an event organiser or 
venue operator may apply to the Minister for Enterprise, Trade 
and Employment to have an event designated for the purposes 
of this Act if, having regard to the nature of the event, the 
applicant is of the reasonable opinion that the event may give 
rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages for that event by a 
secondary ticket seller for a price exceeding the original sale 
price. 

Section 2 of the Act provides that “event organiser”, in relation 
to an event, means a person who— 

(a) is responsible for staging, organising or managing the 

event, or 

(b) a person, acting for, or on behalf of, a person referred to 

in paragraph (a); 

Section 2 of the Act also provides that “venue operator” means a 
person who – 

(a) owns or manages a venue or is otherwise responsible for 

the operation of the venue, or 

(b) a person, including an event organiser, acting for, or on 

behalf of, a person referred to in paragraph (a). 

Note two 

Section 9(3) of the Act provides that an application for the 
designation of an event shall be in writing and in such form as the 
Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment may prescribe 
and shall include— 

(a) the name, address, e-mail address, telephone number and 

website address of the event applicant, 

(b) details (including the proposed date or dates concerned) 
of the event and the address of the venue where the event, 
the subject of the application, will take place, and 

(c) a statement that the event applicant is of the reasonable 
opinion that the event, the subject of the application, may 
give rise to the sale of tickets or ticket packages for that 
event by a secondary ticket seller for a price exceeding 
the original sale price. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 Note three 

Section 9(6) of the Act provides that the Minister for Enterprise, 
Trade and Employment may – 

[399] 15 

(a) designate an event which has been the subject of an 
application under section 9(1) where he or she is satisfied 
of the matters specified in that subsection, or 

(b) subject to section 10(1), refuse to designate an event 
which has been the subject of an application under 
section 9(1) where he or she is not so satisfied. 

Section 9(8) of the Act provides that where the Minister 
designates an event under section 9(6), the Minister shall notify 
the event organiser or venue operator in writing of the 
designation. 

Section 9(9) of the Act provides that a notification of an event 
designation shall include the reason for the designation and the 
date on which it will come into effect. 

Note four 

Section 14 of the Act provides that the Minister for Enterprise, 
Trade and Employment shall establish and maintain a register of 
designated venues and events and shall publish the register on the 
internet or in such other manner as the Minister considers 
appropriate. 

Completed and signed forms can be submitted: 

A. Electronically (pdf) by e-mail to: conspol@enterprise.gov.ie, or 

B. Printed and sent by post to: 

Competition and Consumer Policy Section 

Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment 

1 Earlsfort Centre 

Lower Hatch Street 

Dublin 2 

D02 PW01 

NB: As staff are working remotely at present, scanned copies of forms sent 
by post should also be sent by e-mail to: conspol@enterprise.gov.ie. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16 [399] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 July, 2021. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment..

title: (2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 31st day of July 2021.
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations set out the requirements for a venue operator or an event 
organiser who may wish to apply for designation of a venue(s) or an event under 
Sections 7 and 9 of the Sale of Tickets (Cultural, Entertainment, Recreational 
and Sporting Events) Act 2021, (No. 21 of 2021). 

The Act, at sections 7 and 9, provide that a venue operator or an event organiser 
respectively may apply to the Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment 
for designation of a venue(s) or an event where the relevant conditions are met. 
These provisions also specify how an application should be made and what it 
should contain. 

These Regulations set out these requirements in separate application forms for 
designation of a venue(s) and designation of an event, at Schedules 1 and 2 
respectively.
